ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: This class is the best class I've taken at Yale.

Guest lectures all greatly enhanced learning in the class and were well chosen.Readings a little more on the heavy side and it was obvious that most people dismissed them as being capable of being completed from the beginning of the course.Prof earned great respect by conducting a middle of the semester student input survey. I felt that he did actually take our comments and concerns into consideration going forward.In the beginning especially, the prof did waste a lot of time in class to ask overly obvious questions that only served to interrupt flow of an otherwise interesting lecture. It seems reasonable to assume that everyone in a course like this knows what "outsourcing," etc means, no?
Prof. Esty. His knowledge and experience on the topic is unrivaled. It was great to learn about international trade from one of the top authorities in the field.
Professor Esty is the most clear, eloquent, professional lecturer I've had at Yale. I appreciate his insight through his past and current experiences and willingness to spend time with his students.
The class discussions and the instructor!

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: The reading assignments were heavy and could have been pared down
More discussion
Could have gone a bit more in-depth in investigating issues, but was a good overview.
The timing of the class

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Sufficient
They were really accessible. Thanks a lot!
Very accessible
I never contacted any of them

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: interested in international organizations (their roles in a world / significance / impact etc..) - was a perfect choice to learn about the GATT/WTO
This course broadened my spectrum of interests and makes me considering incorporating trade into my environmental studies

As a social development student and professional, this course enabled me to understand the international trade dynamics and environmental, health and social components that catalyze or inhibit economic development on a national and global scale.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: It seemed like an interesting topic, and I have taken some international law courses before. I also knew that this topic was one of Prof. Esty's specialties.
I wanted to take one of Professor Esty's course and he suggested this one - good thing he did!
Because I was convinced that it was helpful to my career path

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes, and more.
yes
YES! It exceeded my expectations.
Yes!

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes, and more.
yes
YES!
Yes and more

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Don't spend too much time trying to internalize the readings. Skim the readings, and take lots of class notes.
Make sure you go to lectures.
Do the readings!

I am not sure that this course will be taken next year because the instructor is away on study leave. If it were possible to have him teach it during his leave, that will be very great.Tostudents taking this course - I encourage you to do the readings in order to participate in the discussions.
